options.description: path to .fastq.gz files, if files are already compressed use flag -g (see below)
path to output directory
path to Anacapa_db
Illumina adapter type: nextera or truseq
Illumina Platform: HiSeq (2 x 150) or MiSeq ( >= 2 x 250)
If running on an HPC (e.g. UCLA's Hoffman2 cluster), this is your username: e.g. eecurd
If running locally: -l (no argument needed)
path to file with forward primers in fasta format   e.g. >16s
path to file with forward primers in fasta format   e.g. >16s
If .fastq read are not compressed: -g (no argument need)
To modify the allowed cutadapt error for 3' adapter and 5' primer adapter trimming: 0.0 to 1.0 (default 0.3)
To modify the allowed cutadapt error 3' primer sorting and trimming: 0.0 to 1.0 (default 0.3)
To modify the minimum quality score allowed: 0 - 40 (default 35)
To modify the minimum length after quality trimming: 0 - 300 (default 100)
To modify the additional 5' trimming of forward reads: 0 - 300 (default HiSeq 10, default MiSeq 20)
To modify the additional 5' trimming of reverse reads: 0 - 300 (default HiSeq 25, default MiSeq 50)
To modify the number of occurrences required to keep an ASV: 0 - any integer (default 0)

File path to a list of minimum length(s) reqired for paired F and R reads to overlap (length of the locus - primer length + 20 bp). The user should take into account variability in amplicon region (e.g.The amplicon size for 18S 1389f-1510r is ~260 +/- 50 bp) and make appropriate allowances. e.g. LENGTH_16S=235
Path to file with alternate HPC job submission parameters:   default file = ~/Anacapa_db/scripts/Hoffman2_HPC_header.sh modifiable template file = ~/Anacapa_db/scripts/anacapa_qsub_templates.sh
Shows program usage then quits
